cardiovascular.definition: Death of heart muscle tissue due to lack of blood supply, commonly known as a heart attack
cardiovascular.example: The patient presented with chest pain and was diagnosed with an acute myocardial infarction

cardiovascular.definition: High blood pressure, defined as systolic pressure ≥140 mmHg or diastolic pressure ≥90 mmHg
cardiovascular.example: Chronic hypertension increases the risk of stroke and kidney disease

cardiovascular.definition: Irregular heartbeat or abnormal heart rhythm
cardiovascular.example: The ECG showed atrial fibrillation, a common type of arrhythmia

cardiovascular.definition: Hardening and narrowing of arteries due to plaque buildup
cardiovascular.example: Atherosclerosis in the coronary arteries can lead to angina and heart attacks

cardiovascular.definition: Disease of the heart muscle that affects its ability to pump blood effectively
cardiovascular.example: Dilated cardiomyopathy resulted in the patient's heart failure symptoms

respiratory.definition: Infection that inflames air sacs in one or both lungs, which may fill with fluid
respiratory.example: Bacterial pneumonia was confirmed with chest X-ray and sputum culture

respiratory.definition: Chronic respiratory condition causing airway inflammation and breathing difficulties
respiratory.example: The child's asthma was triggered by exposure to dust mites

respiratory.definition: Collapsed lung caused by air leaking into the space between lung and chest wall
respiratory.example: Spontaneous pneumothorax required immediate chest tube insertion

respiratory.definition: Inflammation of the bronchial tubes that carry air to the lungs
respiratory.example: Acute bronchitis typically resolves within 2-3 weeks with supportive care

respiratory.definition: Abnormal accumulation of fluid in the pleural space around the lungs
respiratory.example: Thoracentesis was performed to drain the pleural effusion and relieve dyspnea

neurology.definition: Sudden interruption of blood flow to the brain, causing brain tissue damage
neurology.example: The patient showed signs of acute stroke with left-sided weakness and speech difficulties

neurology.definition: Sudden, uncontrolled electrical disturbance in the brain
neurology.example: The generalized tonic-clonic seizure lasted three minutes

neurology.definition: Severe headache often accompanied by nausea, vomiting, and light sensitivity
neurology.example: Her migraine attacks occur monthly and respond well to triptans

neurology.definition: Damage or dysfunction of peripheral nerves, often causing pain and numbness
neurology.example: Diabetic neuropathy caused tingling and burning sensation in his feet

neurology.definition: Inflammation of the brain tissue, often caused by viral infection
neurology.example: Viral encephalitis was suspected based on fever, headache, and altered mental status

dermatology.definition: Most serious type of skin cancer that develops in melanocytes
dermatology.example: Early detection of melanoma significantly improves treatment outcomes

dermatology.definition: General term for skin inflammation causing redness, swelling, and itching
dermatology.example: Contact dermatitis developed after exposure to poison ivy

dermatology.definition: Chronic skin condition causing dry, itchy, and inflamed skin patches
dermatology.example: Atopic eczema in children often improves with age and proper skin care

dermatology.definition: Autoimmune condition causing rapid skin cell turnover and scaly patches
dermatology.example: Plaque psoriasis commonly affects elbows, knees, and scalp

dermatology.definition: Bacterial skin infection affecting deeper layers of skin and soft tissue
dermatology.example: Cellulitis of the lower leg required immediate antibiotic treatment

musculoskeletal.definition: Break in the continuity of bone tissue
musculoskeletal.example: The X-ray revealed a displaced fracture of the radius bone

musculoskeletal.definition: Inflammation of joints causing pain, stiffness, and reduced range of motion
musculoskeletal.example: Rheumatoid arthritis affects multiple joints symmetrically

musculoskeletal.definition: Condition where bones become weak and brittle due to loss of bone density
musculoskeletal.example: Postmenopausal women are at increased risk for osteoporosis

musculoskeletal.definition: Inflammation of tendons, often due to overuse or repetitive motion
musculoskeletal.example: Tennis elbow is a common form of tendonitis affecting the lateral epicondyle

musculoskeletal.definition: Age-related wear and tear affecting the spinal discs and vertebrae
musculoskeletal.example: Cervical spondylosis can cause neck pain and arm numbness

gastroenterology.definition: Inflammation of the stomach lining often caused by H. pylori bacteria or NSAIDs
gastroenterology.example: Chronic gastritis can lead to peptic ulcers if left untreated

gastroenterology.definition: Inflammation of the appendix requiring emergency surgical removal
gastroenterology.example: Acute appendicitis presents with right lower quadrant abdominal pain

gastroenterology.definition: Yellow discoloration of skin and eyes due to elevated bilirubin levels
gastroenterology.example: Obstructive jaundice may indicate gallstone blockage of the bile duct

gastroenterology.definition: Chronic liver disease characterized by scarring and loss of liver function
gastroenterology.example: Alcohol-related cirrhosis can progress to liver failure

gastroenterology.definition: Inflammatory bowel disease causing ulcers in the colon and rectum
gastroenterology.example: Ulcerative colitis symptoms include bloody diarrhea and abdominal cramping
